    Other QCfuns Functions in QC Workflow

Create Shift Table

Source: R/qc_shift.r
qc_shift.Rd

create shift table, accept up to 3 levels of row variables

Usage

qc_shift(
  input,
  rowcat = "ANRIND",
  colcat = "BNRIND",
  rowvar = c("PARAM", "AVISIT", "TRT01P"),
  drop_zero = TRUE
)

Arguments

input

input dataframe

rowcat

row category variable

colcat

column category variable

rowvar

row variable, Accepted values are a set of two variables such as c("TRT01P", "AVISIT") or three variables such as c("PARAM", "TRT01P", "AVISIT")

drop_zero

if true, replace '0' with NA in N column

Value

shift table by rowvar

Examples

adsl <- data.frame(
  USUBJID = 1:10,
  TRT01P = factor(sample(c("A", "B", "C"), 10, replace = TRUE)))
  
param <- data.frame(PARAM = c("Test1", "Test2"))
visit <- data.frame(AVISIT = c("Baseline", "Visit1", "Visit2"))

adlb0 <- merge(adsl, param)
adlb <- merge(adlb0, visit)

adlb$ANRIND <- factor(sample(c("Low", "Medium", "High"), 60, replace = TRUE), 
                      levels = c("Low", "Medium", "High"))
adlb$BNRIND <- factor(sample(c("Low", "Medium", "High"), 60, replace = TRUE), 
                      levels = c("Low", "Medium", "High"))

tab1 <- qc_shift(adlb, "ANRIND", "BNRIND", rowvar = c("PARAM", "TRT01P", "AVISIT"))
tab1
#> # A tibble: 98 × 6
#>    row_text     N Low   Medium High  Total
#>    <chr>    <int> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>
#>  1 Test1       NA NA    NA     NA    NA   
#>  2 A           NA NA    NA     NA    NA   
#>  3 Baseline     1 NA    NA     NA    NA   
#>  4 Low         NA 1     0      0     1    
#>  5 Medium      NA 0     0      0     0    
#>  6 High        NA 0     0      0     0    
#>  7 Total       NA 1     0      0     1    
#>  8 Visit1       1 NA    NA     NA    NA   
#>  9 Low         NA 1     0      0     1    
#> 10 Medium      NA 0     0      0     0    
#> # ℹ 88 more rows
